title: Data Protection Bill
extract: The Data Protection Act (DPA) is a United Kingdom Act of Parliament which was passed in 1988. It was developed to control how personal or customer information is used by organisations or government bodies. ... The Data Protection Act was replaced in May 2018 by the General Data Protection Regulations (GDPR).
